title: U.S. Returns Dozens Of Artifacts To Iraqi Government
teaser: The U.S. handed over dozens of antiquities to the government of Iraq Monday. The cultural treasures, including a limestone head of the Assyrian King Sargon II, were looted from Iraq and smuggled into the U.S. It's taken more than seven years to identify the pieces and return them.
contentencoded: Copyright 2015 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
